radiographic_examinations.findings: 9-cm right adrenal mass and a normal-appearing left adrenal gland.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Three months after the initial surgery, an abdominal CT scan demonstrated a low-attenuating lesion measuring 2.2 cm in the tumor bed. Follow-up imaging remained clear of disease for 29 months until the summer of 2010 when CT scanning revealed new disease in the liver and intrapulmonary metastases.
In the summer of 2010, revealed new disease in the liver and intrapulmonary metastases.

radiographic_examinations.findings: New multiple liver metastases and retrocaval lymph nodal involvement.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Over 3 months, reduction in the size of liver metastases from 4.4 cm to 2.6 cm, with the right adrenal bed remaining stable.
